messages.message:
cross-posting here:
https://instabase.slack.com/archives/CV8V33RPV/p1693345587613499

getting a keyerror intermittently on instabase.com (http://instabase.com) when I am using call_model_converse() from refiner
@pauline.comising @lydia would we be able to please look into this?

The error message needs some love but the error is actually due to the model failing to access the input files.
Example:
```Exception: Failed to read file: Cannot open a non-existent file in rb mode. Path: SA_Team/demo/fs/fed demo/Federal/NatSec/usg_demo/devOutputv1/s1_process_files/esponaige_war_taiwan_china.pdf.ibmsg```
The file exists at the moment but it could be getting deleted/recreated during flow execution. @Matt Macnak can you check if there is something that can prevent the file from not being present at the time of the LLM query?
i’m not sure, I don’t modify anything in the filesystem during flow execution.  Additionally, I had 5x of these errors on different files
I just reran it & didn’t have the issue this time but I am seeing another error (not sure if this matters or not):

The “invalid usage for resource” error can be ignored for now. It’s failing to update the license for the usage of the embedding model. Not sure if it’s expected, but certainly not relevant to the original errors.

@Matt Macnak, you’re not running the flow multiple times concurrently, are you? I am not sure why the “non-existent file” issue would happen if you’re ensuring that only one execution of the flow is running at a time.
No just one at a time
In that case, since I am not a flow expert, I’ll call on experts @lydia @Anil and @Rakesh for help.
